sen.j: 櫻井清香（さくらい きよか、桜井清香と表記する場合もある、明治28年(1895年)8月7日 - 昭和44年(1969年)、男性）は芸術家（画家）。
sen.e: Kiyoka SAKURAI (August 7, 1895 to 1969, male) was an artist (painter).
Kiyoka SAKURAI (August 7, 1895 to 1969, male) was an artist (painter).
Kiyoka SAKURAI (August 7, 1895 to 1969, male) was an artist (painter).

sen.j: 名古屋市出身。
sen.e: His hometown was Nagoya City.
His hometown was Nagoya City.
His hometown was Nagoya City.

sen.j: 源氏物語絵巻の昭和復元模写を作成したことで有名。
sen.e: He became famous because of his making of the Showa fukugen mosha (restoration duplicate) of "Genji monogatari emaki" (the Illustrated Handscroll of the Tale of Genji).
He became famous because of his making of the Showa fukugen mosha (restoration duplicate) of "Genji monogatari emaki" (the Illustrated Handscroll of the Tale of Genji).
He became famous because of his making of the Showa fukugen mosha (restoration duplicate) of "Genji monogatari emaki" (the Illustrated Handscroll of the Tale of Genji).

sen.j: 父櫻井武愷宮之亟、母三保の二男。
sen.e: His father was Takeyasushinojo SAKURAI, his mother was Miho, and he was their second son.
sen.cmt: 武愷宮之亟の読み方は不明。
sen.e: His father was Takeyasushinojo SAKURAI, his mother was Miho, and he was their second son.
His father was Takeyasushinojo SAKURAI, his mother was Miho, and he was their second son.

sen.j: 兄は桜井馨、弟は桜井鐐三。
sen.e: His elder brother was Kaoru SAKURAI, and his younger brother was Ryozo SAKURAI.
His elder brother was Kaoru SAKURAI, and his younger brother was Ryozo SAKURAI.
His elder brother was Kaoru SAKURAI, and his younger brother was Ryozo SAKURAI.

sen.j: 大正3年3月 旧制愛知県立第五中学校卒業。
sen.e: In March, 1914, he was graduated from the Fifth Aichi Prefectural Junior High School under the old system.
In March, 1914, he was graduated from the Fifth Aichi Prefectural Junior High School under the old system.
In March, 1914, he was graduated from the Fifth Aichi Prefectural Junior High School under the old system.

sen.j: 大正4年8月 日本画家丹羽玉邦（川合玉堂門人）に就いて日本画を学ぶ。
sen.e: In August, 1915, he studied Japanese style painting under the Japanese painter Gyokuho NIWA (a disciple of the Gyokudo KAWAI).
In August, 1915, he studied Japanese style painting under the Japanese painter Gyokuho NIWA (a disciple of the Gyokudo KAWAI).
In August, 1915, he studied Japanese style painting under the Japanese painter Gyokuho NIWA (a disciple of the Gyokudo KAWAI).

sen.j: 以後日本画にて身を立つ。
sen.e: Thereafter, he established himself in the field of Japanese style painting.
Thereafter, he established himself in the field of Japanese style painting.
Thereafter, he established himself in the field of Japanese style painting.

sen.j: 大正9年3月 米騒動絵巻(1918（大正７）年に発生した米騒動の名古屋での出来事をまとめた物)を1年6ヶ月費やし完成。
sen.e: In March, 1920, he spent one year and six months in completing the Rice Riot picture scroll (a scroll that summarizes the happenings in Nagoya during the Rice Riot that occurred in 1918).
In March, 1920, he spent one year and six months in completing the Rice Riot picture scroll (a scroll that summarizes the happenings in Nagoya during the Rice Riot that occurred in 1918).
In March, 1920, he spent one year and six months in completing the Rice Riot picture scroll (a scroll that summarizes the happenings in Nagoya during the Rice Riot that occurred in 1918).

sen.j: 昭和10年 徳川美術館開館。
sen.e: The Tokugawa Art Museum was opened in 1935.
The Tokugawa Art Museum was opened in 1935.
The Tokugawa Art Museum was opened in 1935.

sen.j: それ以来模写のため、時々出仕。
sen.e: Since then, he sometimes attended the spot for the purpose of duplicating.
Since then, he sometimes appeared at the museum for the purpose of duplicating.
sen.cmt: attend the spotでは意味が不明確です。
sen.e: Since then, he sometimes appeared at the museum for the purpose of duplicating.

sen.j: 昭和20年3月 戦災により無一文となる。
sen.e: In March, 1945, he became penniless due to the war damage.
In March, 1945, he became penniless due to the war damage.
In March, 1945, he became penniless due to the war damage.

sen.j: 同年4月1日より4年間、安田生命名古屋支店に勤務。
sen.e: During the four years from April 1 of the same year, he worked for the Nagoya branch of Yasuda Mutual Life Insurance Corporation.
During the four years from April 1 of the same year, he worked for the Nagoya branch of Yasuda Mutual Life Insurance Corporation.
During the four years from April 1 of the same year, he worked for the Nagoya branch of Yasuda Mutual Life Insurance Corporation.

sen.j: 昭和25年4月1日 徳川美術館常勤職員として勤務開始。
sen.e: Since April 1, 1950, he started working as the Tokugawa Art Museum as a full time staff.
Since April 1, 1950, he started working for the Tokugawa Art Museum as a full time staff.
sen.cmt: 「～で働く」という場合の前置詞はforが通常です。
sen.e: Since April 1, 1950, he started working for the Tokugawa Art Museum as a full time staff.

sen.j: 昭和29年11月25日 文部省より人文科学学芸員の資格を与えられる。
sen.e: On November 25, 1954, he was awarded the qualification of being a scholar of humanity science by the Ministry of Education.
On November 25, 1954, he was awarded the qualification of a scholar of humanity science by the Ministry of Education.
sen.cmt: 冗長になるのでbeingは不要です。
sen.e: On November 25, 1954, he was awarded the qualification of a scholar of humanity science by the Ministry of Education.

sen.j: 昭和33年～38年 源氏物語絵巻の昭和復元模写の作成。
sen.e: From 1958 to 1963, he completed the Showa fukugen mosha (restoration duplicate) of "Genji monogatari emaki" (the Illustrated Handscroll of the Tale of Genji).
From 1958 to 1963, he completed the Showa fukugen mosha (restoration duplicate) of "Genji monogatari emaki" (the Illustrated Handscroll of the Tale of Genji).
From 1958 to 1963, he completed the Showa fukugen mosha (restoration duplicate) of "Genji monogatari emaki" (the Illustrated Handscroll of the Tale of Genji).

sen.j: 他多数の作品が徳川美術館に所蔵されている。
sen.e: A lot of his other works were collected in Tokugawa Art Museum.
A lot of his other works were collected in Tokugawa Art Museum.
A lot of his other works were collected in Tokugawa Art Museum.

sen.j: 著述
sen.e: Writing
Writing
Writing

sen.j: 1940年(昭和15年)6月 「戦記絵巻の研究」 日本文献資料研究所
sen.e: June, 1940, "Study of Picture Scrolls of War Chronicles", Japan Research Center of Documentary Records Materials.
June, 1940, "Study of Picture Scrolls of War Chronicles", Japan Research Center of Documentary Records Materials.
June, 1940, "Study of Picture Scrolls of War Chronicles", Japan Research Center of Documentary Records Materials.

sen.j: 1951年(昭和26年)2月 「元寇と竹崎季長蒙古襲来絵詞」 徳川美術館
sen.e: February, 1951, "Mongol invasion of Japan and Takasaki Suenaga Ekotoba", Tokugawa Art Museum.
February, 1951, "Mongol invasion of Japan and Takasaki Suenaga Ekotoba", Tokugawa Art Museum.
February, 1951, "Mongol invasion of Japan and Takasaki Suenaga Ekotoba", Tokugawa Art Museum.

sen.j: 1952年(昭和27年)3月 「源氏物語絵巻」 徳川美術館
sen.e: March, 1952, "Genji monogatari emaki' (the Illustrated Handscroll of the Tale of Genji), Tokugawa Art Museum.
March, 1952, "Genji monogatari emaki' (the Illustrated Handscroll of the Tale of Genji), Tokugawa Art Museum.
March, 1952, "Genji monogatari emaki' (the Illustrated Handscroll of the Tale of Genji), Tokugawa Art Museum.

sen.j: 1969年(昭和44年) 「大和絵と戦記物語」 木耳社
sen.e: 1969, "Japanese Pictures and War Chronicles", Mokujisha.
1969, "Japanese Pictures and War Chronicles", Mokujisha.
1969, "Japanese Pictures and War Chronicles", Mokujisha.

sen.j: 家系図
sen.e: Genealogy
Genealogy
Genealogy

sen.j: 櫻井家は元々は氏を橘（橘氏の流れを汲む氏族である）と名乗っていたが、いつの頃からか櫻井に改めたとされる。
sen.e: Though the SAKURAI family was introducing themselves originally as TACHIBANA (a clan related to the TACHIBANA's blood), it was later changed to SAKURAI.
Though the Sakurai family introduced themselves originally as TACHIBANA (a clan related to the TACHIBANA's blood), somewhere down the line they were renamed SAKURAI.
sen.cmt: 家名は頭文字のみ大文字で表記します。「いつの頃からか」をsomewhere down the lineと訳出します。
sen.e: Though the Sakurai family introduced themselves originally as TACHIBANA (a clan related to the TACHIBANA's blood), somewhere down the line they were renamed SAKURAI.

sen.j: 氏を改めたのは櫻井作之右衛門佐武の時であると考えられる（理由は不明）。
sen.e: The name change is considered to be around the period of Sakurai Sakuno Uemon no Suketake (reason was uncertain).
The name is considered to have been changed around the period of Sakurai Sakuno Uemon no Suketake (it is unknown why the name was changed).
sen.cmt: name changeという名詞表現は一般的ではありません。
sen.e: The name is considered to have been changed around the period of Sakurai Sakuno Uemon no Suketake (it is unknown why the name was changed).
